abstract: There is another way to look at Mitt Romney's consistently low poll numbers among Republicans, which is that he is exactly where he wants to be.
snippet: There is another way to look at Mitt Romney's consistently low poll numbers among Republicans, which is that he is exactly where he wants to be.
lead_paragraph: He's the establishment favorite, the guy who's run before, the clear winner in most debates. He seems eminently electable. So why can't Mitt Romney close the deal with Republican voters?

headline.main: Why It's Good for Romney to Be at 21 Percent
